result.execSummary:
The defendant Thad D Barna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thad D Barna is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thad D Barna was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Thad D Barna was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Thad D Barna was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two for at least 30 hours a week, if not then provide 3 verifiable job contacts per week and perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with A.C. or her children.

SAFE program or equivalent if defendant moves to TX.
LEAP program or equivalent if defendant moves to TX.
DNA sample. (Ct 2 only).
NO days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:05 pm 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault - Use of force/DA)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 5 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault - Use of force)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 3 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 4 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation on Ct. 2 and 2 years probation on Cts. 3 & 4 to run concurrent - CONDITIONS: SAFE program or equivalent if def moves to TX; LEAP program or equivalent if def moves to TX; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 for at least 30 hours per week or if not, provide 3 verifiable job contacts per week and perform 10 hours community service per week; no contact with A.C. or her children; DNA sample on Ct. 2; court costs including 3 DA surcharges. 
COURT remits DNA surcharges on Cts. 3 & 4. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 4:22 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Request For Adjournment of Jury Trial - granted
Status conference on March 23, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:23 am 
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 
Date and time set for hearing on motion to adjourn trial. 
State makes statement. COURT questions parties regarding adjournment. Both parties indicate they would not be prepared to proceed on trial date. 
COURT grants adjournment request and advises parties to see JA to reset trial. 
COURT addresses medical records. 
COURT notes State's MIL and questions Atty Bohn re: those MIL. COURT grants #1-5. COURT defers ruling on #6-7. 
COURT notes Deft's MIL and questions State re: those MIL. COURT grants #1-3, 5, 7-12. COURT gives ruling on #4. COURT defers ruling on #6. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 10:37 am
Subpoena mailed to C.N.T. MD for JT 3/9/15
Subpoena mailed to S.R. MD for JT 3/9/15
Subpoena mailed to A.R.C. for J.T 3/9/15
in limine (stj)
ADA T. Wetzsteon to Judge Jacobson re: medical records (sealed)
Motion hearing on March 2, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:38 pm 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 
Discovery is complied with. State notes deft's motion for in camera inspection and notes it has no objection to that motion. COURT notes notice of intent to introduce medical records at trial. State makes statement re: medical records. COURT questions parties if there will be any motions that will need to be heard prior to commencement of trial. 
COURT advises parties to file proposed jury instructions and any MIL that can be heard morning of trial 3 business days before trial. 
COURT notes there will be 2 alternates on jury and 40 potential jurors to be brought in. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set hearing for end of February or early March. 
Bond Continues.

for Production and In Camera Inspection of Redacted Portions of MedicalRecords - Defense - stj
